title: A Conceptual Comparison between Density-based Clustering algorithms
abstract: Data and information have become an integral part of our lives today. The world revolves around data to this abundance of data, and data analytics has become very important. A popular method to gather some useful information from data is clustering. Density-based clustering is a subset of Cluster analysis that groups the components according to the spatial density of the objects. The real-world data available or collected is usually mixed in nature, i.e., is comprised of numerical and categorical data types. The standard algorithms are generally designed to handle only a single data type. Many density-based clustering algorithms are implemented on benchmark heterogeneous datasets and compared in this study. The performance of these algorithms is then evaluated using some benchmark evaluation metrics.
venue: 2023 IEEE International Conference on Contemporary Computing and Communications (InC4)

journal.name: 2023 IEEE International Conference on Contemporary Computing and Communications (InC4)
